hypothesis_content.title: Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of extreme volatility compression (Bollinger Band Width < 20th percentile) in a NEUTRAL regime, a breakout above the 20-period SMA with expanding volume will lead to a directional move exceeding 1.5x the recent ATR within 3 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended periods of low volatility (compression) in neutral markets often precede significant directional moves as pent-up energy is released. The combination of a technical breakout and confirming volume suggests a genuine shift in supply/demand dynamics.
entry_conditions: BTC 1D Bollinger Band Width (20,2) < 20th percentile of its 90-day lookback
BTC closes above its 20-period SMA on the daily timeframe
Daily volume is > 120% of its 20-day average

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price moves 1.5x the 14-day ATR from entry in the direction of the breakout
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price closes below the lower Bollinger Band (20,2)
exit_conditions.time_exit: 3 days after entry if TP/SL not hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such signals result in a failed breakout (price returns within the Bollinger Bands before hitting TP) over a 2-year backtest period.
